description: CLARA aims to uncover the underlying reasons why potential clients chose competitors or paused their work, gathering insights directly from clients to identify gaps in a value proposition, improve commercial strategies, pinpoint product strengths/weaknesses, pricing gaps, and service and sales deficiencies. By systematically gathering and analyzing feedback, CLARA can enhance strategies, increase win rates, and better serve the market [1, 2].

interview_details.purpose: The purpose is to improve future engagements and the client's feedback is greatly valued [3].
interview_details.recording_policy: The interview will be recorded for transcript use only, and the recording will be deleted once the transcript is downloaded [3].
interview_details.confidentiality: Confirm the confidentiality of the discussion [3].

points: Thank the client for their time and confirm the confidentiality of the discussion [3].
Emphasize that the purpose is to improve future engagements and that their feedback is greatly valued [3].
Briefly recap the opportunity, including the solution offered, timeline, and key decision points [3].

questions.text: Could you share the top factors influencing your decision?
questions.answer: The top factors influencing the decision were implementation confidence, prior sector experience, and alignment with their leadership team. The chosen provider had more relevant case studies and a delivery lead with deep retail experience.
questions.evidence: We prioritised implementation confidence, prior sector experience and alignment with our leadership team and the chosen provider had more relevant case studies and a delivery lead with deep retail experience which made us feel more assured.

questions.text: How did our proposal compare to the chosen provider in terms of:
sub_points: Product fit/alignment with your specific needs
questions.note: Pricing: Neutral, Service capability: Negative, Product fit: Positive
questions.answer: Pricing was neutral, as both proposals were similar in cost, although they appreciated the more flexible payment terms of our proposal. Service capability was slightly less compelling due to the competitor having an experienced delivery lead that matched the industry. Product fit was positive, as they found our product more modern and adaptable, with an impressive user interface.
questions.evidence: For pricing, it was neutral overall. Both proposals were similar in cost, though yours offered more flexible payment terms which we appreciated. Service capacity was slightly less compelling. The other provider had a named delivery lead with experience that matched our industry which tipped the balance. And in terms of product fit alignment, it was positive. Your product felt more modern and adaptable and we were particularly impressed with the user interface.

questions.text: Were there any specific gaps or areas where our offering didn't meet your expectations?
questions.answer: The integration with their payroll systems required custom work, and there was uncertainty about the level of post-implementation support compared to the competitor.
questions.evidence: Integration with our payroll systems was a concern as yours would have required custom work. We were also unsure about the level of post implementation support compared to the competitor.

questions.text: Without naming them, what aspects of the chosen provider's offering stood out to your team?
questions.answer: The chosen provider had highly relevant references in their industry, were perceived as experts in change management, and had an impressive stakeholder engagement plan.
questions.evidence: They offered highly relevant references in our industry and came across as experts in change management. Their stakeholder engagement plan was particularly impressive.

questions.text: Did the competitor offer anything innovative or particularly compelling that tipped the scales?
questions.answer: Yes, their analytics package included retail-specific dashboards that were highly valuable and saved the client from needing to build them in-house.
questions.evidence: Yes, their analytics package included retail specific dashboards which we found highly valuable and the sale just from having to build them in-house.

questions.text: How would you describe your experience working with our team?
questions.answer: The experience was positive overall. Communication was excellent, described as clear and professional. Responsiveness was praised, being quick to adapt to changes. Understanding of needs was generally good, though some specifics like seasonal hiring were addressed later than expected.
questions.evidence: I thought your team had excellent communication, clear, professional throughout the process. You were really responsive, adapted quickly to when we shifted requirements. And in terms of understanding our needs, I thought it was generally good, although there are a few specific details like seasonal hiring which were picked up later than we expected.

questions.text: Were there moments in the process where our approach stood out, either positively or negatively?
questions.answer: The early stage workshops were outstanding and set a great tone. However, the rotation of attendees from our side disrupted continuity slightly.
questions.evidence: Your early stage workshops were outstanding and set a great tone. One drawback was the rotation of attendees from your side, which disrupted continuity slightly.

questions.text: How would you describe the chemistry and collaboration between your team and ours?
questions.answer: No information available in the transcript to answer this question.

questions.text: Did any specific interactions, meetings, or presentations stand out positively or negatively?
questions.answer: No information available in the transcript to answer this question.

questions.text: Despite this decision, do you see potential opportunities for us to work together in the future?
questions.answer: Yes, there is potential for future collaborations, particularly around Learning & Development or talent systems.
questions.evidence: Definitely. Your team showed strategic thinking and a broader view of transformation. We'd definitely be open to exploring future collaborations, especially around L&D or talent systems.

questions.text: What would you need to see from us to feel more confident in choosing us for a future project?
questions.answer: No information available in the transcript to answer this question.
